issue.title: cron_restart starts job on server startup

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:

    Thank you for contributing to PM2!

    About a new issue, please check that there is no duplicate:
         https://github.com/Unitech/pm2/search?type=Issues

    If not please fill out the following questions:
-->

**What's going wrong?**
cron job starts immediately after server starts up
```bash
pm2 start ecosystem.json
```
but it should not

**How could we reproduce this issue?**
ecosystem.json
```json
{
  "apps": [
    {
      "name": "CRON",
      "script": "test.js",
      "cron_restart": "0 11 * * *",
      "exec_mode": "cluster"
    }
  ]
}
```

test.js
```js
console.log(new Date());
```

## Supporting information

```
PM2 version: `pm2 -v` 2.4.4 / dev
Node version: `node -v` 6.10.0
Windows? Mac? Linux? Mac
```

issue.title: Add ability to choose to start now an app with cron_restart option

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
Hi there, I'm using cron_restart in my ecosystem config file.

The issue is that when I start/restart an app which contains the cron_restart option, the app is started at the moment.

I think it should be great to add an option (for example "start_now") to determine if the app should be started now or only when the cron_restart option matches.

```
PM2 version: `2.4.2`
Node version: `6.9.4`
Centos 7
```

issue.title: scheduled task as cron running a program haiving process.exit() causes status to be stopped/errored

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing to PM2!

    About a new issue, please check that there is no duplicate:
         https://github.com/Unitech/pm2/search?type=Issues

    If not please fill out the following questions:
-->

**What's going wrong?**
Using application declartion trying to have a "cron" job kind of task running every "X" minutes, if the app that need to run have "process.exit()" command the status column on "pm2 list" returns "stopped" and sometimes "errored".

**How could we reproduce this issue?**
using a .config.js file and simple js script file with these:
```js
module.exports = {
  /**
   * Application configuration section
   * http://pm2.keymetrics.io/docs/usage/application-declaration/
   */
  apps : [
    // First application
    {
      name      : "cron_simpleConsole",
      script    : "/home/pm2schedule_test.js",
      args: "myargs",
      cron_restart: "*/1 * * * *",
      autorestart: false,
    }
  ]
}
```
The simple js file
```js
var env = process.env.NODE_ENV || 'development';
var arg = process.argv[2];
console.log('I was executed! - ',env,'-',arg,'-', Date().toLocaleString());
process.exit();
```
Note: **this is just example code of using process.exit(), it is not the code i use but it has the same result i am trying to fix/understand**

running this config with pm2 will cause it to run once and be stopped/errored and never run again.
I know some will say "process.exit()" should not be called but sometimes i have no choice or else it big code refactoring which is not what i am after.

Is this how it is suppose to be? thanks!
## Supporting information

```
PM2 version: `2.4.2` 
Node version: `6.9.2`
Linux distro
```

issue.title: Add a possibility to run one-time scripts by crontab

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
Let's say I have the application that has some scripts (that are not constantly running, they just do their job and quit) that are needed to be run at certain periods of time. (My case: I have the server application and a script (simple `.js` file) that makes a dump of the database, zips it into a file and moves it into a separate folder. And this script needs to run every `n` hours.)

It would be awesome to have the possibility to start these scripts with PM2 and have a config setup where you can specify when these scripts should be started.

There is `cron_restart` option, but it's not quite what I want.
